description: Doncaster Rovers reveal they recorded an operating loss of £3,059m for the year ending 30 June 2024.
title: Doncaster Rovers: League Two club lost £3m for year ending 30 June 2024
title_page: Doncaster Rovers: League Two club lost £3m for year ending 30 June 2024 - BBC Sport
maintext:
Doncaster Rovers have revealed they recorded operating losses of £3,059m for the year ending 30 June 2024.
The League Two club, who had lost £1,795m in the previous year, improved their position from 18th in 2022-23 to fifth.
However, they were knocked out in the play-off semi-finals by Crewe in May 2024 to miss out on a return to League One.
In a statement on the club website, external they said that £556,000 of the additional losses were down to player salaries and that "the overall health of the club's finances improved".
The South Yorkshire side are fourth in League Two, one point behind Port Vale but with a game in hand.
